node.title: Coroner finds police not to blame for deaths of teenagers who drowned in Swan River after chase
node.alt: WA Police officers on horseback look out over the Swan River in Maylands.
node.description: WA's coroner delivers a report into the drownings of two boys who were running away from police, describing the actions of the teenagers as "dangerous and very risky" and saying the officers involved acted appropriately.
node.content:
["Western Australia's coroner has handed down a report into the drownings of two Indigenous teenagers who were running away from police, describing the\u00a0actions of the boys\u00a0as \"dangerous and very risky\".\u00a0", "Three recommendations for police changes have been issued by the coroner after the incident in Perth,\u00a0on September 10, 2018, sparked scrutiny over the actions of officers.", "Post-mortem examinations by forensic pathologists found the 16-year-old and 17-year-old drowned after they and two friends entered\u00a0the Swan River in Maylands, in an attempt to evade two officers who were chasing them on foot.", "\"Given the weather conditions and the width of the river, this was a dangerous and very risky undertaking to attempt\", Coroner Philip Urquhart said in his report about the actions of the boys, referred to as Master Drage and Master Simpson.\u00a0", "", "
The actions of police after the boys entered the water came under scrutiny at the inquest.(ABC News: James Carmody)
", "But Coroner Urquhart said he was satisfied the teenagers would not have been aware of the treacherous conditions of the river when they decided to attempt to swim across it.", "He said the two police officers who chased the group had acted appropriately at all times.", "The\u00a0report comes after a coronial inquest into the deaths of the boys in March this year.", "A man who was part of the group that was chased by officers\u00a0told the inquest\u00a0he believed\u00a0police could have done more to save his friends from drowning, saying he had called out to them to help.", "
Police changes recommended
", "One of the officers who pursued the teenagers\u00a0was still on probation and the other was just five months from finishing their probationary period.", "Coroner Urquhart has recommended the WA Police Force introduce a policy\u00a0that whenever possible, probationary constables carrying out operational duties be partnered with a police officer with a post-probationary operational experience of at least one year.", "", "
A memorial with the Aboriginal flag was created at the river near where the boys died.(ABC News: David Weber)
", "He also called for all police officers assigned to operational duties in a defined area to receive an induction upon being posted to the area for the first time.", "The induction should include\u00a0an identification of its boundaries and significant physical, demographic, cultural and socio-economic features of that area.", "A third recommendation was made to enhance and strengthen relationships between police and Aboriginal people.", "Coroner Urquhart said newly promoted first class constables and senior constables at metropolitan and regional police stations should undertake immersive, face-to-face cultural awareness training.", "
Inquest told details of chase
", "Master Drage and Master Simpson were among a group of five\u00a0teenage boys who had met and travelled to Maylands, where the inquest in March heard they burgled a home.", "When the boys saw a police vehicle in the area\u00a0they started running. One split off from the group, while the others ran towards and entered\u00a0the river, pursued by two plain-clothes officers on foot.", "Two Tactical Response Group [TRG] officers, who happened to be in the area, were the first to go after them into the water,\u00a0where the current was described as \"very strong\" and conditions \"very challenging\".", "", "
SES volunteers searched the river after the boys entered the water and two failed to reappear.(ABC News: James Carmody)
", "The court was told the river was estimated to be more than 100 metres wide at the point the boys went in.", "One boy, known as Child P, had stopped in the river at waist height when he realised the water was very cold, and another boy, known as Child N, made it to the other side at Rivervale.", "But Master Drage and Master Simpson did not emerge from the river.", "The court was told the pair\u00a0had been affected by cannabis.", "A witness who watched from a nearby balcony told the inquest police had done all they could to save the teenagers.", "
Officer unable to recall boy's call\u00a0for help
", "The inquest also heard from the officers who had been pursuing the group and the TRG officers who entered the water in a\u00a0bid to save them.", "WA\u00a0Police officer Ella Cutler was 20 years old and still on probation when she and her partner\u00a0Lindsay Jeffree\u00a0were flagged down by a member of the public while they were patrolling the Maylands area.", "The officers were alerted to a group of boys jumping fences in the area, and they stopped at a home where there was evidence of trespass.", "When they saw the group of boys running, she said it raised her suspicions, and the officers\u00a0made the decision to pursue them on foot.", "Ms Cutler told the court she did not know the area well and was unaware the river was there, although she said she did not believe it would have changed their actions.", "", "
Police divers were called in to search for the missing boys and recovered their bodies.(ABC News: James Carmody)
", "She said she was focused on the boy who had stopped and was standing in the river, and said she did not recall him asking her to help the others.", "She said her training had not involved anything specific about swimming or water rescues.", "The TRG officers later told the inquest conditions in the water on the day were the worst they had experienced, with one saying the current \"was ridiculously strong\".", "Both men received bravery awards for their actions that day, and\u00a0said they did not think there was anything else the plain-clothes\u00a0officers could have done."]
